title.native: アイドルマスター ミリオンライブ！

description:
Mirai Kasuga, who wants to carry on a dream she has yet to see. Shizuka Mogami, who yearns to be an idol and is shaken. Tsubasa Ibuki, who does not know what she can be serious about.

At 765 Production new idols gather and everyone's "dreams" will brought into brilliance at the theater! The long-awaited anime of "The IDOLM@STER Million Live!!

(Source: Official Site, translated)
synonyms: Тот, кто зажигает звёзды: Миллионный концерт!

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

node.description: **Hakuta Masato (白田真人)** is a Japanese art director, art designer and concept artist.
**Hida Ryuki (肥田竜二)** is a Japanese animator.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Website](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/masakierica/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masakierica)

Erika Masaki is a Japanese singer and lyricist affiliated with the Lantis label.

Johann Sebastian Bach was a German composer, organist, harpsichordist, violist, and violinist whose sacred and secular works for choir, orchestra, and solo instruments drew together the strands of the Baroque period and brought it to its ultimate maturity.    

(Source: Wikipedia)
